SEARCH
Package CreditCard

Class CreditCard

java.lang.Object
CreditCard.CreditCard
public class CreditCard extends Object
CreditCard class is used to store information of a customer's credit card based on their card number. The class has methods which work together with the Account it will be attached to, to perform transactions and other functions of a credit card.

  • Constructor Details

    • CreditCard

      public CreditCard(String customerName, int accountID, long cardNumber, double creditLimit)
      Generic class constructor for class private attributes
      Parameters:
      customerName - Name of Customer
      accountID - The unique identifier for each account
      cardNumber - The card number assigned to the credit card
      creditLimit - The limit the credit card can charge. This does not change.

    • CreditCard

      public CreditCard(long cardNumber)
      Special constructor which fetches the information from CreditCard.csv and places them into the creditCard arraylist. It reads the data from the CreditCard.csv containing CardNumber, CustomerName, CreditLimit, ExpiryDate, AccountID and Balance. Use to perform functionalities of a credit card class based on the credit card number. For loop is used for assigning data from csv into the local variable, to retrieve the data in printCreditCardDetails method.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - passed a cardNumber of long data type to be used to be retrieved from the csv file.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main class is used for testing purposes to show the functionalities of the CreditCard Class
      Parameters:
      args - is default parameter for main class.

    • chargeCredit

      public void chargeCredit(double amount)
      chargeCredit checks for the amount that will be charged into the credit card. It checks for 3 things prior to successful charging of Credit Card: if the credit card is expired; if the given amount is a valid number; if it has exceeded the credit limit. If the amount for chargeCredit passes these checks, it can successfully charge the credit card.
      Parameters:
      amount - is used to charge the amount into the creditCard

    • payBill

      public void payBill(double amount)
      payBill checks if it is a valid amount before proceeding to pay off the credit card's balance. This method is used in contrast to chargeCredit: when charging the credit card, one has to pay off his or her balance as well.
      Parameters:
      amount - is used to indicate how much amount is used to pay the bill/balance.

    • printAllCreditCards

      public static void printAllCreditCards(int accountID)
      printAllCreditCards retrieves the information of all the credit cards of a certain account ID.
      Parameters:
      accountID - is the ID for credit card

    • setCreditLimit

      public void setCreditLimit(double creditLimit)
      This method is to set the creditLimit of a credit card. The limit can only be set between 1 and 100000. If the limit is set below 1 or above 100000, it will be invalid.
      Parameters:
      creditLimit - to check the limit of the credit between 1 and 1000000

    • setCardExpiry

      public void setCardExpiry(LocalDate date)
      Sets credit card's new expiry date based on the input argument
      Parameters:
      date - retrieves the current date and adds 5 years which will be the new exipiry date to set to.
